result.execSummary:
The defendant John M Schwinn-Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Cash bond of $150 is applied to financial obligations owed - BALANCE DUE = $293

The defendant can pay $30 per month with the first payment due 9-15-15 and each subsequent payment will be due the 15th of every month until paid in full
.

The defendant is to comply with the Intensive Outpatient Therapy through American Society for Addiction Medicine and get verification of completion of the program to the Clerk of Court to be eligible for 973.015.  All Court costs must be paid in full and Community Service must be completed and verification sent to Clerk of Courts  for 973.015 to be done
.

The defendant must complete 25 hours of Community Service and send verification of completion to the Clerk of Court to get 973.015 done
.
